data.text: @kamal_hothi Animate vax rates by SA2? Unfortunately they didnâ€™t start releasing the SA2 data until rates were like 60% I think. Will have a think about other ideas. Ping @Thoughtfulnz and @jmarshallnz
@aschiff I will have a look. I was also thinking of doing the other animation you mentioned last year. Playing with Svelte.js and need use cases.

@kamal_hothi Yes that could be useful. I've not quite set up the data to allow filtering over time but shouldn't be too hard. My code & data is in here if you want to reuse it https://t.co/bshvmCeBF8 (benchmarking.R)
@aschiff Over time and filtering by countries is what I was thinking
@kamal_hothi 😃 sure, what kind of interaction do you think would be useful for this?
@KazemiAlex Yes boosters are in the OWD data, I should add that. Unfortunately OWD still don't have hospitalisations for NZ.
@aschiff I might have a few weeks within jobs, would you like an interactive version?  🙂
@aschiff These look great Aaron (the visualisations I mean). Would booster rates be a useful addition (if they were accessible)?

@Thoughtfulnz Here's the daily maximum estimated Reff (according to OWD's method of estimating it)

I wanted to do daily max cases and deaths too, but some countries don't report cases on weekends, or only report deaths once per week, so it requires more fiddling than I have time for right now https://t.co/YBlT21e7vs
